company.name: mResource LLC
company.business_description: mResource LLC, doing business as Loop Works LLC, offers recruitment and talent management services.

case_info.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

complaint.factual_background: mResource LLC, doing business as Loop Works LLC, is a recruitment and talent management company that participated in the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield framework after self-certifying in December 2016. When its certification expired in December 2017, Respondent failed to complete the steps necessary to renew its participation. Despite allowing its certification to lapse, Respondent continued to publish statements on its website claiming to be a current participant in the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield framework and that it adhered to Privacy Shield Principles. The FTC brought this action under Section 5 of the FTC Act for deceptive trade practices.

representations_made.description: Claimed to be a current participant in the U.S. Department of Commerce's EU-U.S. Privacy Shield, having certified adherence to EU-U.S. Privacy Shield Principles and remaining liable for onward transfers of EU individuals' data
representations_made.quoted_text: EU-U.S. Privacy Shield Loop is a participant in the U.S. Department of Commerce’s EU- U.S. Privacy Shield and has certified that we adhere to the EU- U.S. Privacy Shield Principles. Loop is subject to the investigatory and enforcement powers of the Federal Trade Commission. For more information about the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield Framework, visit the U.S. Department of Commerce’s Privacy Shield website at https://www.commerce.gov/privacyshield * * * Page 2 of 3 In cases of onward transfer to third parties of data of EU individuals received pursuant to the EU-US Privacy Shield, Loop remains liable.

counts.title: Privacy Shield Participation Misrepresentation
counts.representation: Respondent represents, directly or indirectly, expressly or by implication, that it is a current participant in the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield.
counts.fact: Respondent was not a current participant in the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield, having allowed its December 2016 certification to lapse in December 2017 without completing the necessary renewal steps.
counts.conclusion: Therefore, the representation set forth in Paragraph 11 is false or misleading.

definitions.Respondent: mResource LLC, a corporation, also doing business as Loop Works LLC, and its successors and assigns.

provisions.title: Prohibition against Misrepresentations about Participation in Privacy or Security Programs
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent, in any manner, the extent to which it is a member of, adheres to, or participates in any privacy or security program sponsored by a government or self-regulatory/standard-setting organization, including the EU-U.S. and Swiss-U.S. Privacy Shield frameworks.

requirements.description: Must not misrepresent participation or membership in any privacy or security program, including but not limited to the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield framework and the Swiss-U.S. Privacy Shield framework
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS ORDERED that Respondent and its officers, agents, employees, and attorneys, and all other persons in active concert or participation with any of them, who receive actual notice of this Order, whether acting directly or indirectly, in connection with the advertising, marketing, promotion, offering for sale, or sale of any product or service must not misrepresent in any manner, expressly or by implication, the extent to which Respondent is a member of, adheres to, complies with, is certified by, is endorsed by, or otherwise participates in any privacy or security program sponsored by a government or any self-regulatory or standard-setting organization, including but not limited to the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield framework and the Swiss- U.S. Privacy Shield framework.

provisions.title: Acknowledgments of the Order
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit its own acknowledgment of receipt of this Order to the Commission, deliver copies to relevant personnel and any successor business entities, and obtain signed acknowledgments from each recipient.

requirements.description: Submit acknowledgment of receipt of this Order to the Commission within 10 days after the effective date
requirements.quoted_text: A. Respondent, within ten (10) days after the effective date of this Order, must submit to the Commission an acknowledgment of receipt of this Order.

requirements.description: For 5 years after issuance, deliver a copy of this Order to all principals, officers, directors, LLC managers and members, employees with managerial responsibilities related to the Order, agents and representatives who participate in related conduct, and any successor business entities; delivery for current personnel must occur within 10 days after the effective date, and for all others before they assume responsibilities
requirements.quoted_text: B. For five (5) years after the issuance date of this Order, Respondent must deliver a copy of this Order to: (1) all principals, officers, directors, and LLC managers and members; (2) all employees having managerial responsibilities for conduct related to the subject matter of the Order and all agents and representatives who participate in conduct related to the Page 2 of 5 subject matter of the Order; and (3) any business entity resulting from any change in structure as set forth in the Provision titled Compliance Report and Notices. Delivery must occur within ten (10) days after the effective date of this Order for current personnel. For all others, delivery must occur before they assume their responsibilities.
requirements.deadline: 10 days (current personnel); before assuming responsibilities (new personnel)

requirements.description: Obtain a signed and dated acknowledgment of receipt of this Order from each individual or entity to which a copy was delivered, within 30 days of delivery
requirements.quoted_text: C. From each individual or entity to which Respondent delivered a copy of this Order, Respondent must obtain, within thirty (30) days, a signed and dated acknowledgment of receipt of this Order.

provisions.title: Compliance Report and Notices
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit an initial sworn compliance report within 60 days of issuance, and must submit sworn notices within 14 days of changes to designated contacts, corporate structure, or any bankruptcy filing.

requirements.description: Submit a sworn compliance report within 60 days of issuance, identifying contact points, all businesses and their activities, compliance status with each provision, and copies of acknowledgments obtained
requirements.quoted_text: A. Sixty (60) days after the issuance date of this Order, Respondent must submit a compliance report, sworn under penalty of perjury, in which Respondent must: (a) identify the primary physical, postal, and email address and telephone number, as designated points of contact, which representatives of the Commission, may use to communicate with Respondent; (b) identify all of Respondent’s businesses by all of their names, telephone numbers, and physical, postal, email, and Internet addresses; (c) describe the activities of each business; (d) describe in detail whether and how Respondent is in compliance with each Provision of this Order; and (e) provide a copy of each Acknowledgment of the Order obtained pursuant to this Order, unless previously submitted to the Commission.

requirements.description: Submit a sworn compliance notice within 14 days of any change to designated points of contact or to the structure of Respondent or any entity it owns or controls that may affect compliance obligations
requirements.quoted_text: B. Respondent must submit a compliance notice, sworn under penalty of perjury, within fourteen (14) days of any change in the following: (1) any designated point of contact; or (2) the structure of Respondent or any entity that Respondent has any ownership interest in or controls directly or indirectly that may affect compliance obligations arising under this Order, including: creation, merger, sale, or dissolution of the entity or any subsidiary, parent, or affiliate that engages in any acts or practices subject to this Order.

requirements.description: Submit notice of any bankruptcy petition, insolvency proceeding, or similar proceeding filed by or against Respondent within 14 days of its filing
requirements.quoted_text: C. Respondent must submit notice of the filing of any bankruptcy petition, insolvency proceeding, or similar proceeding by or against Respondent within fourteen (14) days of its filing.

requirements.description: All submissions sworn under penalty of perjury must be true and accurate and comply with 28 U.S.C. § 1746, concluding with the specified declaration language including date, full name, title, and signature
requirements.quoted_text: D. Any submission to the Commission required by this Order to be sworn under penalty of perjury must be true and accurate and comply with 28 U.S.C. § 1746, such as by concluding: “I declare under penalty of perjury under the laws of the United States of America that the foregoing is true and correct. Executed on: _____” and supplying the date, signatory’s full name, title (if applicable), and signature.

requirements.description: Unless otherwise directed in writing, all submissions must be emailed to Debrief@ftc.gov or sent by overnight courier to the Associate Director of Enforcement, Bureau of Consumer Protection, FTC, with subject line beginning: In re mResource LLC, FTC File No. 1823143
requirements.quoted_text: E. Unless otherwise directed by a Commission representative in writing, all submissions to the Commission pursuant to this Order must be emailed to Debrief@ftc.gov or sent by overnight courier (not the U.S. Postal Service) to: Associate Director of Enforcement, Bureau of Consumer Protection, Federal Trade Commission, 600 Pennsylvania Avenue, N.W., Washington, D.C. 20580. The subject line must begin: In re mResource LLC, FTC File No. 1823143.

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must create and retain specified records for 20 years after issuance (retaining each for 5 years), including accounting records, personnel records, compliance records, and copies of all advertising materials subject to this Order.

requirements.description: Create and retain accounting records showing revenues from all goods or services sold, for 20 years after issuance (retaining each record for 5 years)
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Respondent must create certain records for twenty (20) years after the issuance date of the Order, and retain each such record for five (5) years. Specifically, Respondent must create and retain the following records: A. accounting records showing the revenues from all goods or services sold;

requirements.description: Create and retain personnel records showing name, addresses, telephone numbers, job title or position, dates of service, and reason for termination for each person providing services
requirements.quoted_text: B. personnel records showing, for each person providing services, whether as an employee or otherwise, that person’s: name; addresses; telephone numbers; job title or position; dates of service; and (if applicable) the reason for termination;

requirements.description: Create and retain all records necessary to demonstrate full compliance with each provision of this Order, including all submissions to the Commission
requirements.quoted_text: C. all records necessary to demonstrate full compliance with each provision of this Order, including all submissions to the Commission; and

requirements.description: Create and retain a copy of each unique advertisement or other marketing material making a representation subject to this Order, and all materials relied upon in making the representation
requirements.quoted_text: D. a copy of each unique advertisement or other marketing material making a representation subject to this Order, and all materials that were relied upon in making the representation.

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission is authorized to monitor Respondent's compliance by requesting additional reports and records, communicating directly with Respondent, interviewing affiliated individuals, and using all other lawful means including undercover methods.

requirements.description: Within 10 days of a written request from a Commission representative, submit additional sworn compliance reports or other requested information and produce records for inspection and copying
requirements.quoted_text: A. Within ten (10) days of receipt of a written request from a representative of the Commission, Respondent must: submit additional compliance reports or other requested information, which must be sworn under penalty of perjury, and produce records for inspection and copying.

requirements.description: Permit Commission representatives to communicate directly with Respondent and to interview anyone affiliated with Respondent who has agreed to such an interview (interviewee may have counsel present)
requirements.quoted_text: B. For matters concerning this Order, representatives of the Commission are authorized to communicate directly with Respondent. Respondent must permit representatives of the Commission to interview anyone affiliated with Respondent who has agreed to such an interview. The interviewee may have counsel present.

requirements.description: The Commission may use all other lawful means, including posing as consumers, suppliers, or other individuals or entities, without identification or prior notice, and may use compulsory process under Sections 9 and 20 of the FTC Act
requirements.quoted_text: C. The Commission may use all other lawful means, including posing through its representatives as consumers, suppliers, or other individuals or entities, to Respondent or any individual or entity affiliated with Respondent, without the necessity of identification Page 4 of 5 or prior notice. Nothing in this Order limits the Commission’s lawful use of compulsory process, pursuant to Sections 9 and 20 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 49, 57b-1.

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates
provisions.summary: This Order becomes final and effective upon publication on the FTC's website and will terminate on November 15, 2038, or 20 years from the most recent date the Commission files a complaint alleging a violation, whichever is later, subject to specified exceptions.

requirements.description: Order is final and effective upon publication on the Commission's website (ftc.gov) as a final order
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this Order is final and effective upon the date of its publication on the Commission’s website (ftc.gov) as a final order. This Order will terminate on

requirements.description: Order terminates on November 15, 2038, or 20 years from the most recent date the United States or the Commission files a complaint alleging any violation, whichever comes later, subject to specified exceptions for provisions with shorter durations, non-named respondents, and post-termination filings
requirements.quoted_text: publication on the Commission’s website (ftc.gov) as a final order. This Order will terminate on November 15, 2038, or twenty (20) years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint (with or without an accompanying settlement) in federal court alleging any violation of the Order, whichever comes later; provided, however, that the filing of such a complaint will not affect the duration of: A. any Provision in this Order that terminates in less than twenty (20) years; B. this Order’s application to any respondent that is not named as a defendant in such complaint; and C. this Order if such complaint is filed after the order has terminated pursuant to this Provision. Provided, further, that if such complaint is dismissed or a federal court rules that Respondent did not violate any provision of the Order, and the dismissal or ruling is either not appealed or upheld on appeal, then the Order will terminate according to this Provision as though the complaint had never been filed, except that the Order will not terminate between the date such complaint is filed and the later of the deadline for appealing such dismissal or ruling and the date such dismissal or ruling is upheld on appeal.
requirements.deadline: November 15, 2038 or 20 years from most recent violation complaint, whichever is later

duration.termination_text: This Order will terminate on November 15, 2038, or twenty (20) years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint (with or without an accompanying settlement) in federal court alleging any violation of the Order, whichever comes later; provided, however, that the filing of such a complaint will not affect the duration of: A. any Provision in this Order that terminates in less than twenty (20) years; B. this Order's application to any respondent that is not named as a defendant in such complaint; and C. this Order if such complaint is filed after the order has terminated pursuant to this Provision.
